items.title: CES award outs MSI's monstrous 1600W RTX 5090 Lightning GPU â€” new flagship has next generation liquid cooling,  dual 16-pin power connectors, and a surface-mounted LCD display
items.summary: For a few weeks now, we've known about MSI's RTX 5090 Lightning, a return to form for an iconic lineup of GPUs targeted at extreme overclocking. This new 5090 Lightning is no different with a 1600W power limit (2500W XOC BIOS) split across dual 12V-2x6 connectors, a large screen, and liquid-cooled â€¦

Clicks, the brand behind the Clicks Keyboard for iPhone, announced the new Communicator smartphone ahead of CES 2026. It features a touch-sensitive physical keyboard paireâ€¦

items.title: Centurion Root eyes next Ashes series down under
items.summary: Joe Root says he would "love" to be part of England's next Ashes tour in 2029-30, when he will turn 39 years old.

items.title: Rice, Watkins & Cunha make cut - FPL team of the week
items.summary: Erling Haaland retains the captaincy despite his run of blanks but, if he fails to score against Brighton, FPL managers can start to panic.

items.title: Root hits 160 but Head leads Australia's response on day two
items.summary: Joe Root hits 160 as England are bowled out for 384 in their first innings of the fifth Test with Australia closing day two 218 runs behind, as they finish on 166-2 at stumps, with Travis Head unbeaten on 91 in Sydney.

items.title: '2/10' - how England's bowling unravelled in Sydney
items.summary: Why England's bowling performance on day two of the fifth Test is an alarming hint to the future.

items.title: Steelers late show completes play-off field as road to Super Bowl is set
items.summary: We look at the pick of the action and the full play-off picture and schedule after the Pittsburgh Steelers' dramatic late victory completes the road to the Super Bowl.

items.title: Can you name the Premier League's oldest ever players?
items.summary: James Milner could make a Premier League appearance after his 40th birthday on Wednesday. Can you name the other 18 players to have done so?

items.title: Djokovic cuts ties with player union he co-founded
items.summary: Novak Djokovic says he has ended his involvement with the Professional Tennis Players Association that he co-founded, expressing concerns over "transparency and governance".

items.title: Realme Neo8 to debut in January with Snapdragon 8 Gen 5 SoC
items.summary: Realme has confirmed that its Neo8 gaming phone will debut later this month in China. While the company did not reveal an exact launch date, it has unveiled the phoneâ€™s design and its chipset. The Realme Neo8 will be powered by the Snapdragon 8 Gen 5 SoC. As per a poster, the phone has achieved a bâ€¦

items.title: Rosenior deserves Chelsea chance, says Rooney
items.summary: Wayne Rooney says Liam Rosenior is as good a coach as he has worked with and deserves the chance to be Chelsea manager.

items.title: Rosenior as good a coach as I've ever worked with - Rooney
items.summary: With Liam Rosenior in talks to fill the vacant manager's role at Chelsea, Wayne Rooney speaks on his former Derby County colleague and explains why he thinks Rosenior deserves to manage in the Premier League.

items.title: 'He can bat in Australia!' - Root hits sublime 160 for England
items.summary: Watch the best shots of Joe Root's first innings as he scores an impressive 160 to help England to 384 all out against Australia on day two of the fifth Ashes Test in Sydney.

items.title: Root receives standing ovation as sublime innings comes to an end
items.summary: Joe Root's excellent first innings comes to an end as he's caught and bowled by Michael Neser for 160, to leave England on 384-9 on day two of the fifth Ashes Test in Sydney.

items.title: 'Brainless' Smith wicket 'sums up' England's Ashes
items.summary: England wicketkeeper Jamie Smith's dismissal by Australia part-timer Marnus Labuschagne is called "one of the worst" ever in Tests and "completely brainless".

items.title: 'One of the worst dismissals I've seen' - Smith gifts wicket to Australia
items.summary: Jamie Smith gifts his wicket to Australia as he's caught for 46 off the bowling of part-time bowler Marnus Labuschagne, as England fall to 323-6 just before lunch on day two of the fifth Ashes Test in Sydney.

items.title: Ex-Australia batter Martyn wakes up from coma in 'miracle' recovery
items.summary: Martyn, who played 67 Test matches from 1992 to 2006, was diagnosed with meningitis late last month.

items.title: Could Liverpool have stopped Reed's 'unbelievable' goal?
items.summary: Match of the Day pundit Shay Given analyses Harrison Reed's superb late goal that rescued a point for Fulham as Gary O'Neil highlights his disappointment with Liverpool's defence.

items.title: The man carrying the creative burden at Man Utd
items.summary: Match of the Day pundit Gary O'Neil breaks down Matheus Cunha's solid performance for Manchester United and ultimate equaliser against Leeds United.

items.title: Brook falls short of century as Australia get early breakthrough
items.summary: Harry Brook falls short of his first century in Australia, as he adds just six runs to his overnight score before being caught for 84 by Steve Smith to end a 169-run partnership between Brook and Joe Root, leaving England on 226-4 on day two of the fifth Ashes Test in Sydney.

items.title: Expected Chelsea boss Rosenior has 'served his apprenticeship'
items.summary: Match of the Day pundits discuss the expected appointment of Liam Rosenior as Chelsea head coach following the departure of Enzo Maresca amid internal tensions at the club.

items.title: Asus ROG Xbox Ally X review
items.summary: The ROG Xbox Ally X is the newest handheld gaming device from Asus, and the third of its kind from the company in as many years. The Xbox Ally X, along with the cheaper Xbox Ally, is made in collaboration with Microsoft's Xbox division, and features a unique design that mirrors Xbox controllers, asâ€¦

items.title: Chelsea have shown character through manager changes - McFarlane
items.summary: Interim manager Calum McFarlane credits the leaders in the Chelsea dressing room for the character they have shown through a tumultuous week which saw manager Enzo Maresca sacked.

items.title: 'I was sure it was offside' - why did Wirtz equaliser stand?
items.summary: Florian Wirtz thought his goal for Liverpool in the 2-2 draw at Fulham was offside - so how did technology allow it to stand?

items.title: 'Maybe you know better than me!' - Guardiola defends performance
items.summary: Manchester City manager Pep Guardiola says how his side defended and played outside the final third was "extraordinary" and disagrees with Man City having a lack of momentum after failing to secure a second goal in a 1-1 draw against managerless Chelsea at the Etihad.

items.title: 'Struggling Frank trapped in gilded cage at joyless Tottenham'
items.summary: Struggling head coach Thomas Frank is trapped in a gilded cage at joyless Tottenham Hotspur, says chief football writer Phil McNulty.

items.title: Real Madrid youngster Garcia scores hat-trick in place of Mbappe
items.summary: Watch highlights as Real Madrid beat Real Betis 5-1, with 21-year-old striker Gonzalo Garcia, starting in place of the injured Kylian Mbappe, scoring a hat-trick.

items.title: Thelin 'accepts' Aberdeen sacking after winless run
items.summary: Aberdeen sack manager Jimmy Thelin following a five-match winless run and just eight months on from the club's Scottish Cup win.

items.title: 'It's not enough'- Slot frustrated with Fulham draw
items.summary: Liverpool manager Arne Slot says "it's not enough" for his side to rely on late goals after a "frustrating" 2-2 draw against Fulham at Craven Cottage.
